word:
Brother Guenin's eldest son had taken no part with the church for more than a year. He spoke with deep feeling, confessing his wrongs. . . . His mother spoke for the first time. She became disgusted with the course of Czechowski and she became prejudiced with all who came from America, but a change came over her and she expressed her desire to take part with the people of God.--Ms 29, 1887, p. 2. (Diary, February 5, 1887.) 

Released September 16, 1974.
